speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, Hal, what time of day is it, lad?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou art so fat-witted, with drinking of old sack

text_entry: benches after noon, that thou hast forgotten to

speaker: PRINCE HENRY

speaker: PRINCE HENRY

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: capons and clocks the tongues of bawds and dials the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: signs of leaping-houses and the blessed sun himself

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: a fair hot wench in flame-coloured taffeta, I see no

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: reason why thou shouldst be so superfluous to demand

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: the time of the day.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Indeed, you come near me now, Hal; for we that take

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: purses go by the moon and the seven stars, and not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: by Phoebus, he,that wandering knight so fair. And,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I prithee, sweet wag, when thou art king, as, God

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: save thy grace,--majesty I should say, for grace

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thou wilt have none,--

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, none?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No, by my troth, not so much as will serve to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: prologue to an egg and butter.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, how then? come, roundly, roundly.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Marry, then, sweet wag, when thou art king, let not

speaker: FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thieves of the days beauty: let us be Dianas

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: foresters, gentlemen of the shade, minions of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: moon; and let men say we be men of good government,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: being governed, as the sea is, by our noble and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: chaste mistress the moon, under whose countenance we steal.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou sayest well, and it holds well too; for the

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: fortune of us that are the moons men doth ebb and

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: flow like the sea, being governed, as the sea is,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: by the moon. As, for proof, now: a purse of gold

speaker: PRINCE HENRY

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: dissolutely spent on Tuesday morning; got with

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: swearing Lay by and spent with crying Bring in;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: now in as low an ebb as the foot of the ladder

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and by and by in as high a flow as the ridge of the gallows.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: By the Lord, thou sayest true, lad. And is not my

speaker: FALSTAFF

speaker: PRINCE HENRY

speaker: FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF

text_entry: And tis no little reason bids us speed,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To save our heads by raising of a head;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: For, bear ourselves as even as we can,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: The king will always think him in our debt,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And think we think ourselves unsatisfied,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Till he hath found a time to pay us home:

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: And see already how he doth begin

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To make us strangers to his looks of love.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: He does, he does: well be revenged on him.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Cousin, farewell: no further go in this

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Than I by letters shall direct your course.

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: When time is ripe, which will be suddenly,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Ill steal to Glendower and Lord Mortimer;

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Where you and Douglas and our powers at once,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: As I will fashion it, shall happily meet,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: To bear our fortunes in our own strong arms,

speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
text_entry: Which now we hold at much uncertainty.

speaker: NORTHUMBERLAND
text_entry: Farewell, good brother: we shall thrive, I trust.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Uncle, Adieu: O, let the hours be short

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Till fields and blows and groans applaud our sport!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: SCENE I. Rochester. An inn yard.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter a Carrier with a lantern in his hand

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Heigh-ho! an it be not four by the day, Ill be

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: hanged: Charles wain is over the new chimney, and

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: yet our horse not packed. What, ostler!

speaker: Ostler
text_entry: [Within]   Anon, anon.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: I prithee, Tom, beat Cuts saddle, put a few flocks

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: in the point; poor jade, is wrung in the withers out

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: of all cess.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Enter another Carrier

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Peas and beans are as dank here as a dog, and that

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: is the next way to give poor jades the bots: this

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: house is turned upside down since Robin Ostler died.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Poor fellow, never joyed since the price of oats

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: rose; it was the death of him.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: I think this be the most villanous house in all

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: London road for fleas: I am stung like a tench.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Like a tench! by the mass, there is neer a king

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: christen could be better bit than I have been since

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: the first cock.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Why, they will allow us neer a jordan, and then we

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: leak in your chimney; and your chamber-lie breeds

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: fleas like a loach.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: What, ostler! come away and be hanged!

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: I have a gammon of bacon and two razors of ginger,

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: to be delivered as far as Charing-cross.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Gods body! the turkeys in my pannier are quite

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: starved. What, ostler! A plague on thee! hast thou

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: never an eye in thy head? canst not hear? An

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: twere not as good deed as drink, to break the pate

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: on thee, I am a very villain. Come, and be hanged!

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: hast thou no faith in thee?

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Enter GADSHILL

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Good morrow, carriers. Whats oclock?

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: I think it be two oclock.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: I pray thee lend me thy lantern, to see my gelding

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: in the stable.

speaker: First Carrier
text_entry: Nay, by God, soft; I know a trick worth two of that, i faith.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: I pray thee, lend me thine.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Ay, when? canst tell? Lend me thy lantern, quoth

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: he? marry, Ill see thee hanged first.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Sirrah carrier, what time do you mean to come to London?

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Time enough to go to bed with a candle, I warrant

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: thee. Come, neighbour Mugs, well call up the

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: gentleman: they will along with company, for they

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: have great charge.

speaker: Second Carrier
text_entry: Exeunt carriers

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: What, ho! chamberlain!

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: [Within]  At hand, quoth pick-purse.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Thats even as fair as--at hand, quoth the

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: chamberlain; for thou variest no more from picking

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: of purses than giving direction doth from labouring;

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: thou layest the plot how.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Good morrow, Master Gadshill. It holds current that

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I told you yesternight: theres a franklin in the

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: wild of Kent hath brought three hundred marks with

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: him in gold: I heard him tell it to one of his

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: company last night at supper; a kind of auditor; one

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: that hath abundance of charge too, God knows what.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: They are up already, and call for eggs and butter;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: they will away presently.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Sirrah, if they meet not with Saint Nicholas

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: clerks, Ill give thee this neck.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: No, Ill none of it: I pray thee keep that for the

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: hangman; for I know thou worshippest St. Nicholas

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: as truly as a man of falsehood may.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: What talkest thou to me of the hangman? if I hang,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Ill make a fat pair of gallows; for if I hang, old

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Sir John hangs with me, and thou knowest he is no

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: starveling. Tut! there are other Trojans that thou

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: dreamest not of, the which for sport sake are

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: content to do the profession some grace; that would,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: if matters should be looked into, for their own

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: credit sake, make all whole. I am joined with no

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: foot-land rakers, no long-staff sixpenny strikers,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: none of these mad mustachio purple-hued malt-worms;

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: but with nobility and tranquillity, burgomasters and

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: great oneyers, such as can hold in, such as will

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: strike sooner than speak, and speak sooner than

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: drink, and drink sooner than pray: and yet, zounds,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: I lie; for they pray continually to their saint, the

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: commonwealth; or rather, not pray to her, but prey

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: on her, for they ride up and down on her and make

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: her their boots.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: What, the commonwealth their boots? will she hold

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: out water in foul way?

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: She will, she will; justice hath liquored her. We

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: steal as in a castle, cocksure; we have the receipt

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: of fern-seed, we walk invisible.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Nay, by my faith, I think you are more beholding to

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: the night than to fern-seed for your walking invisible.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Give me thy hand: thou shalt have a share in our

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: purchase, as I am a true man.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Nay, rather let me have it, as you are a false thief.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Go to; homo is a common name to all men. Bid the

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: ostler bring my gelding out of the stable. Farewell,

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: you muddy knave.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: SCENE II. The highway, near Gadshill.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Come, shelter, shelter: I have removed Falstaffs

speaker: POINS
text_entry: horse, and he frets like a gummed velvet.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Stand close.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Poins! Poins, and be hanged! Poins!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Peace, ye fat-kidneyed rascal! what a brawling dost

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou keep!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Wheres Poins, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He is walked up to the top of the hill: Ill go seek him.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I am accursed to rob in that thiefs company: the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rascal hath removed my horse, and tied him I know

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not where. If I travel but four foot by the squier

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: further afoot, I shall break my wind. Well, I doubt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not but to die a fair death for all this, if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: scape hanging for killing that rogue. I have

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: forsworn his company hourly any time this two and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: twenty years, and yet I am bewitched with the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rogues company. If the rascal hath not given me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: medicines to make me love him, Ill be hanged; it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: could not be else: I have drunk medicines. Poins!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hal! a plague upon you both! Bardolph! Peto!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Ill starve ere Ill rob a foot further. An twere

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: not as good a deed as drink, to turn true man and to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: leave these rogues, I am the veriest varlet that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ever chewed with a tooth. Eight yards of uneven

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ground is threescore and ten miles afoot with me;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and the stony-hearted villains know it well enough:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: a plague upon it when thieves cannot be true one to another!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: They whistle

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Whew! A plague upon you all! Give me my horse, you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rogues; give me my horse, and be hanged!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Peace, ye fat-guts! lie down; lay thine ear close

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: to the ground and list if thou canst hear the tread

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: of travellers.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Have you any levers to lift me up again, being down?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Sblood, Ill not bear mine own flesh so far afoot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: again for all the coin in thy fathers exchequer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: What a plague mean ye to colt me thus?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou liest; thou art not colted, thou art uncolted.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I prithee, good Prince Hal, help me to my horse,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: good kings son.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Out, ye rogue! shall I be your ostler?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Go, hang thyself in thine own heir-apparent

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: garters! If I be taen, Ill peach for this. An I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have not ballads made on you all and sung to filthy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: tunes, let a cup of sack be my poison: when a jest

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: is so forward, and afoot too! I hate it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter GADSHILL, BARDOLPH and PETO

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Stand.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: So I do, against my will.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: O, tis our setter: I know his voice. Bardolph,

speaker: POINS
text_entry: what news?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: Case ye, case ye; on with your vizards: there s

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: money of the kings coming down the hill; tis going

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: to the kings exchequer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You lie, ye rogue; tis going to the kings tavern.

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Theres enough to make us all.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: To be hanged.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Sirs, you four shall front them in the narrow lane;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned Poins and I will walk lower: if they scape

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: from your encounter, then they light on us.

speaker: PETO
text_entry: How many be there of them?

speaker: GADSHILL
text_entry: Some eight or ten.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Zounds, will they not rob us?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, a coward, Sir John Paunch?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Indeed, I am not John of Gaunt, your grandfather;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: but yet no coward, Hal.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Well, we leave that to the proof.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Sirrah Jack, thy horse stands behind the hedge:

speaker: POINS
text_entry: when thou needest him, there thou shalt find him.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Farewell, and stand fast.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now cannot I strike him, if I should be hanged.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned, where are our disguises?

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Here, hard by: stand close.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Exeunt PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Now, my masters, happy man be his dole, say I:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: every man to his business.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Enter the Travellers

speaker: First Traveller
text_entry: Come, neighbour: the boy shall lead our horses down

speaker: First Traveller
text_entry: the hill; well walk afoot awhile, and ease our legs.

speaker: Thieves
text_entry: Stand!

speaker: Travellers
text_entry: Jesus bless us!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Strike; down with them; cut the villains throats:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: ah! whoreson caterpillars! bacon-fed knaves! they

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: hate us youth: down with them: fleece them.

speaker: Travellers
text_entry: O, we are undone, both we and ours for ever!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Hang ye, gorbellied knaves, are ye undone? No, ye

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fat chuffs: I would your store were here! On,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: bacons, on! What, ye knaves! young men must live.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: You are Grand-jurors, are ye? well jure ye, faith.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Here they rob them and bind them. Exeunt

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The thieves have bound the true men. Now could thou

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and I rob the thieves and go merrily to London, it

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: would be argument for a week, laughter for a month

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and a good jest for ever.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Stand close; I hear them coming.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Enter the Thieves again

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Come, my masters, let us share, and then to  horse

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: before day. An the Prince and Poins be not two

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: arrant cowards, theres no equity stirring: theres

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: no more valour in that Poins than in a wild-duck.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Your money!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Villains!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: As they are sharing, the Prince and Poins set upon  them; they all run away; and Falstaff, after a blow or two, runs away too, leaving the booty behind them

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Got with much ease. Now merrily to horse:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The thieves are all scatterd and possessd with fear

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: So strongly that they dare not meet each other;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Each takes his fellow for an officer.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Away, good Ned. Falstaff sweats to death,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And lards the lean earth as he walks along:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Were t not for laughing, I should pity him.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: How the rogue roard!

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: POINS
text_entry: SCENE III. Warkworth castle

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR, solus, reading a letter

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But for mine own part, my lord, I could be well

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: contented to be there, in respect of the love I bear

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your house. He could be contented: why is he not,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: then? In respect of the love he bears our house:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: he shows in this, he loves his own barn better than

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: he loves our house. Let me see some more. The

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: purpose you undertake is dangerous;--why, thats

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: certain: tis dangerous to take a cold, to sleep, to

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: drink; but I tell you, my lord fool, out of this

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety. The

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: purpose you undertake is dangerous; the friends you

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: have named uncertain; the time itself unsorted; and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: your whole plot too light for the counterpoise of so

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: great an opposition. Say you so, say you so? I say

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: unto you again, you are a shallow cowardly hind, and

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: you lie.  What a lack-brain is this! By the Lord,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: our plot is a good plot as ever was laid; our

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: friends true and constant: a good plot, good

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: friends, and full of expectation; an excellent plot,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: very good friends. What a frosty-spirited rogue is

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: this! Why, my lord of York commends the plot and the

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: general course of action. Zounds, an I were now by

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: this rascal, I could brain him with his ladys fan.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is there not my father, my uncle and myself? lord

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Edmund Mortimer, My lord of York and Owen Glendower?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: is there not besides the Douglas? have I not all

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: their letters to meet me in arms by the ninth of the

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: next month? and are they not some of them set

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: forward already? What a pagan rascal is this! an

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: infidel! Ha! you shall see now in very sincerity

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: of fear and cold heart, will he to the king and lay

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: open all our proceedings. O, I could divide myself

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: and go to buffets, for moving such a dish of

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: skim milk with so honourable an action! Hang him!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: let him tell the king: we are prepared. I will set

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: forward to-night.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter LADY PERCY

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: How now, Kate! I must leave you within these two hours.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: O, my good lord, why are you thus alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: For what offence have I this fortnight been

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: A banishd woman from my Harrys bed?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Tell me, sweet lord, what ist that takes from thee

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Thy stomach, pleasure and thy golden sleep?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Why dost thou bend thine eyes upon the earth,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And start so often when thou sitst alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Why hast thou lost the fresh blood in thy cheeks;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And given my treasures and my rights of thee

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: To thick-eyed musing and cursed melancholy?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: In thy faint slumbers I by thee have watchd,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And heard thee murmur tales of iron wars;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Speak terms of manage to thy bounding steed;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Cry Courage! to the field! And thou hast talkd

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of sallies and retires, of trenches, tents,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of palisadoes, frontiers, parapets,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of basilisks, of cannon, culverin,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Of prisoners ransom and of soldiers slain,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And all the currents of a heady fight.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Thy spirit within thee hath been so at war

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And thus hath so bestirrd thee in thy sleep,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: That beads of sweat have stood upon thy brow

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Like bubbles in a late-disturbed stream;

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And in thy face strange motions have appeard,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Such as we see when men restrain their breath

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: On some great sudden hest. O, what portents are these?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Some heavy business hath my lord in hand,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: And I must know it, else he loves me not.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What, ho!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter Servant

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Is Gilliams with the packet gone?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: He is, my lord, an hour ago.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Hath Butler brought those horses from the sheriff?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: One horse, my lord, he brought even now.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What horse? a roan, a crop-ear, is it not?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: It is, my lord.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: That roan shall by my throne.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Well, I will back him straight: O esperance!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Bid Butler lead him forth into the park.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: But hear you, my lord.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What sayst thou, my lady?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: What is it carries you away?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Why, my horse, my love, my horse.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Out, you mad-headed ape!

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: A weasel hath not such a deal of spleen

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: As you are tossd with. In faith,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Ill know your business, Harry, that I will.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I fear my brother Mortimer doth stir

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: About his title, and hath sent for you

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: To line his enterprise: but if you go,--

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: So far afoot, I shall be weary, love.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Come, come, you paraquito, answer me

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Directly unto this question that I ask:

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: In faith, Ill break thy little finger, Harry,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: An if thou wilt not tell me all things true.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Away,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Away, you trifler! Love! I love thee not,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I care not for thee, Kate: this is no world

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To play with mammets and to tilt with lips:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: We must have bloody noses and crackd crowns,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And pass them current too. Gods me, my horse!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: What sayst thou, Kate? what wouldst thou

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: have with me?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Do you not love me? do you not, indeed?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Well, do not then; for since you love me not,

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: I will not love myself. Do you not love me?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Nay, tell me if you speak in jest or no.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Come, wilt thou see me ride?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And when I am on horseback, I will swear

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I love thee infinitely. But hark you, Kate;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I must not have you henceforth question me

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I go, nor reason whereabout:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I must, I must; and, to conclude,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: This evening must I leave you, gentle Kate.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I know you wise, but yet no farther wise

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than Harry Percys wife: constant you are,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But yet a woman: and for secrecy,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: No lady closer; for I well believe

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Thou wilt not utter what thou dost not know;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And so far will I trust thee, gentle Kate.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: How! so far?

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Not an inch further. But hark you, Kate:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Whither I go, thither shall you go too;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To-day will I set forth, to-morrow you.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Will this content you, Kate?

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: It must of force.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: SCENE IV. The Boars-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

speaker: LADY PERCY
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY and POINS

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ned, prithee, come out of that fat room, and lend me

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thy hand to laugh a little.

speaker: POINS
text_entry: Where hast been, Hal?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: With three or four loggerheads amongst three or four

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: score hogsheads. I have sounded the very

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: base-string of humility. Sirrah, I am sworn brother

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: to a leash of drawers; and can call them all by

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: their christen names, as Tom, Dick, and Francis.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: They take it already upon their salvation, that
